title: [KAIST SoC Colloquium] Reconstruction and synthesis 3D humans in 3D scenes
content: title:[KAIST SoC Colloquium] Reconstruction and synthesis 3D humans in 3D scenes date:2024-05-13T00:00:00Z link:https://cs.kaist.ac.kr/board/view?bbs_id=events&bbs_sn=11095&page=1&skey=&svalue=&menu=86 content:Speaker: Siyu Tang (ETH Zürich) Title: Reconstruction and synthesis 3D humans in 3D scenes Time: 16:00 , May 13, 2024 Location : Zoom (Link: https://kaist.zoom.us/j/84101178320?pwd=QnRFVURYbTNNbFZ2ejBTRlB0NzNHdz09 ) Language: English Here is the speaker's biography. Bio I’m an assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science at ETH Zürich. I lead the Computer Vision and Learning Group (VLG) at the Institute of Visual Computing. Before joining ETH, I received an early career research grant to start my research group at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems in November 2017. I was a postdoctoral researcher in the same institute, advised by Dr. Michael Black. I obtained my PhD at the Max Planck Institute for Informatics in 2017, under the supervision of Professor Bernt Schiele. Before that, I obtained my Master’s degree in Media Informatics at RWTH Aachen University and Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science at Zhejiang University, China. If you want more information about the colloquium, please refer to the colloquium page: https://cs.kaist.ac.kr/colloquium/ . location: 온라인 tag:csweb.calendar
